title: Production-ready copy, booking UX hardening, and SEO metadata for the 3D restaurant site

requirements.summary: Audit and update all user-facing copy to be production-appropriate English with friendly reservation messaging.
acceptanceCriteria: No visible UI text contains the words “draft”, “expired”, or “demo”.
All user-facing UI strings are in English across hero, menu, booking, gallery, contact, navbar, and footer sections.
Reservation success and error messages shown in the UI are clear, user-friendly English messages (no raw trap text shown directly).

file_operations.description: Update the document <title> to production-appropriate restaurant branding language (remove template-like phrasing such as “3D Restaurant Website with …”).

Refine reservation success and failure UI copy to be consistently production-ready English and ensure error messaging shown to users is sanitized (no raw backend/agent error text surfaced). Use the existing shadcn-ui Button/Card/Select/Input/Textarea and sonner toasts for consistent presentation; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Review and adjust any visible navbar labels/brand text as needed to ensure consistent production-ready English phrasing throughout navigation. Use the existing shadcn-ui Button/Sheet components as-is; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Review and adjust footer headings, descriptions, and link labels to ensure all visible copy is production-ready English and consistent with the site’s branding tone.

Review and adjust hero headline/subheadline and button labels if needed to ensure production restaurant tone and consistent English copy (no template/draft language). Use the existing shadcn-ui Button component as-is; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Review and adjust booking section title/description to ensure production-ready English and alignment with updated reservation messaging.
Review and adjust menu section title/description to ensure production-ready English and consistent tone.
Review and adjust gallery section title/description to ensure production-ready English and consistent tone.
Review and adjust contact section title/description and any visible labels to ensure production-ready English and consistent tone.

requirements.summary: Harden the reservation flow UX with robust loading/success/error states and prevention of accidental double submissions.
acceptanceCriteria: While a reservation request is in-flight, the submit button is disabled and shows a clear loading state.
On success, the UI shows a confirmation state/toast and the form behaves consistently (e.g., resets or clearly indicates completion).
On failure, the UI shows a readable error message and allows the user to retry without page refresh.
Rapid repeated clicks do not create duplicate reservations from the same UI action.

file_operations.description: Add a reliable in-flight guard to prevent overlapping reservation submissions (even with rapid repeated clicks) and normalize thrown errors into safe, user-presentable messages (avoid passing through raw agent/canister text).

Ensure the form uses robust UI states: disable submit (and optionally inputs) during in-flight requests, show a clear loading label, display a clear success confirmation state/toast and consistent post-success behavior, and show a friendly retryable error message on failure. Use existing shadcn-ui form controls and sonner toasts for state messaging; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add production-grade document metadata (meta description and Open Graph tags) for SEO/sharing without changing functionality or routing.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html includes a meaningful meta description in English.
frontend/index.html includes basic Open Graph tags (og:title, og:description, og:type) aligned with the site’s branding/copy.
The app still loads correctly and renders the existing sections (Hero, Menu, Booking, Gallery, Contact) with no routing changes required.

file_operations.description: Add/adjust production-ready metadata: set a concise restaurant-focused <title>, add an English meta description, and include Open Graph tags (og:title, og:description, og:type) aligned with the updated branding/copy while keeping the existing app bootstrapping unchanged.
